page.title: 06Woodland Destruction
page.content: {Destruction of the ancient woodland {on St Chad's Road - Report by 1A { }The trees along St Chad's Road are all that remain of an ancient woodland,over 300 years old. The Council plan to destroy the trees in order to replace an old sewage pipeline which lies along the former bank of the River Dee. Many people in Blacon, especially those who live near by feel very strongly about this destruction. Miss Ashton, our science teacher, belongs to 'The Men of the Trees' who have collected 5,000 signatures to protest. She has been in the paper and on the radio to gain support. On the 9th July 1985 the councillors met at the Town Hall, and decided to accept an alternative plan. The trees which should have been felled on the 1st July 1985 have been {SAVED}!
